title: Woods of Wonder
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 464 words, Level L (Grade 2), Lexile 750L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     O and R
description: Old-growth forests are interesting and unique ecosystems. Developing over hundreds or thousands of years, these forests are home to the largest trees on Earth as well as other plants and animals that can be found nowhere else. Read to find out where these forests exist and about a few of the animals that live in them. Book and lesson are also available at Levels O and R.
highFrequencyWords: canopy, coniferous, deciduous, endangered, old-growth, protect
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
comprehension: Vowel Digraphs : Identify vowel digraphs ea and ee
phonics: Synonyms                : Identify and find synonyms using a thesaurus
grammar:
Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
